API Documentation¶

class flirimageextractor.FlirImageExtractor(exiftool_path='exiftool', is_debug=False, palettes=[<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>, <matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>, <matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>])¶
check_for_thermal_image(flir_img_filename)¶

Given a valid image path, return a boolean of whether the image contains thermal data :param flir_img_filename: Input path for the flir image :return: Bool

extract_embedded_image()¶

extracts the visual image as 2D numpy array of RGB values

static extract_float(dirtystr)¶

Extract the float value of a string, helpful for parsing the exiftool data :return:

extract_thermal_image()¶

extracts the thermal image as 2D numpy array with temperatures in oC

get_image_type()¶

Get the embedded thermal image type, generally can be TIFF or PNG :return:

get_metadata(flir_img_file)¶

Given a valid file path or file-like object get relevant metadata out of the image using exiftool

Parameters

flir_img_file –

Returns

get_rgb_np()¶

Return the last extracted rgb image :return:

get_thermal_np()¶

Return the last extracted thermal image :return:

plot(palette=<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>)¶

Plot the rgb and thermal image (easy to see the pixel values), include a matplotlib colormap to change the colors :return:

process_image(flir_img_file, RGB=False)¶

Given a valid image path, process the file: extract real thermal values and a thumbnail for comparison (generally thumbnail is on the visible spectre) :param flir_img_file: Input path for the flir image :param RGB: Boolean for whether to extract the embedded RGB image :return:

static raw2temp(raw, E=1, OD=1, RTemp=20, ATemp=20, IRWTemp=20, IRT=1, RH=50, PR1=21106.77, PB=1501, PF=1, PO=-7340, PR2=0.012545258)¶

convert raw values from the flir sensor to temperatures in C # this calculation has been ported to python from # https://github.com/gtatters/Thermimage/blob/master/R/raw2temp.R # a detailed explanation of what is going on here can be found there

save_images(min=None, max=None, bytesIO=False)¶

Save the extracted images :return:
